qas.question: How did Frederick respond to the Russian occupation of east Prussia?
How large a force did Frederick send against the occupying Russians?
How many Russians were in defense?
What country was Prussia fighting on another front?

context: By this point Frederick was increasingly concerned by the Russian advance from the east and <a0_0>marched to counter it.<a0_0/> Just east of the Oder in Brandenburg-Neumark, at the Battle of Zorndorf (now Sarbinowo, Poland), a Prussian army of <a1_0>35,000 men<a1_0/> under Frederick on Aug. 25, 1758, fought a <a2_0>Russian army of 43,000<a2_0/> commanded by Count William Fermor. Both sides suffered heavy casualties – the Prussians 12,800, the Russians 18,000 – but <a3_0>the Russians withdrew<a3_0/>, and Frederick claimed victory. In the undecided Battle of Tornow on 25 September, a <a4_0>Swedish<a4_0/> army repulsed six assaults by a Prussian army but did not push on Berlin following the Battle of Fehrbellin.
